pokedex_entries.Diamond: It whips up blizzards in mountains that are always buried in snow. It is the abominable snowman.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up blizzards. It is also known as “The Ice Monster.”
pokedex_entries.Platinum: They appear when the snow flowers bloom. When the petals fall, they retreat to places unknown again.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: They appear when the snow flowers bloom. When the petals fall, they retreat to places unknown again.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up blizzards. It is also known as “The Ice Monster.”
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.
pokedex_entries.Sword: If it sees any packs of Darumaka going after Snover, it chases them off, swinging its sizable arms like hammers.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon is known to bring blizzards. A shake of its massive body is enough to cause whiteout conditions.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It whips up blizzards in mountains that are always buried in snow. It is the abominable snowman.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up blizzards. It is also known as the Ice Monster.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: A powerful Pokémon that can split huge boulders with ease. Dislikes associating with others and chooses to live quietly deep within the mountains, playing with the snow.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.
pokedex_entries.Violet: They appear when the snow flowers bloom. When the petals fall, they retreat to places unknown again.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: They work in large colonies and make rings by linking their tails, apparently in friendship.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Split into two, the tails are so adept at handling and doing things, AMBIPOM rarely uses its hands.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: They live on large trees. They are said to communicate by connecting their tails to those of others.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It is very difficult to dodge the consecutive strikes of its two tails.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Split into two, the tails are so adept at handling and doing things, Ambipom rarely uses its hands.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They work in large colonies and make rings by linking their tails, apparently in friendship.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: In their search for comfortable trees, they get into territorial disputes with groups of Passimian. They win about half the time.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It uses its tails for everything. If it wraps both of its tails around you and gives you a squeeze, that’s proof it really likes you.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: They work in large colonies and make rings by linking their tails, apparently in friendship.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: To affirm their kinship, members of this species will form a ring by linking their newly doubled tails together. On rare occasions, humans have been accepted into such rings.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It is described in mythology as the Pokémon that shaped the universe with its 1,000 arms.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It is said to have emerged from an egg in a place where there was nothing, then shaped the world.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: According to the legends of Sinnoh, this Pokémon emerged from an egg and shaped all there is in this world.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It is said to have emerged from an egg in a place where there was nothing, then shaped the world.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It is said to have emerged from an egg in a place where there was nothing then shaped the world.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: According to the legends of Sinnoh, this Pokémon emerged from an egg and shaped all there is in this world.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It is described in mythology as the Pokémon that shaped the universe with its 1,000 arms.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was the first Pokémon born before the universe even existed.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Known as “The Being of Willpower.” It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It is thought that UXIE, MESPRIT and AZELF all came from the same egg.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: When AZELF flew, people gained the determination to do things. It was the birth of willpower.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: This Pokémon is said to have endowed humans with the determination needed to face any of life’s difficulties.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: When Azelf flew, people gained the determination to do things. It was the birth of willpower.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Known as “The Being of Willpower.” It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf all came from the same egg.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It is known as the Being of Willpower. It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf all came from the same egg.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: The dreaded Being of Willpower. Legends tell of this Pokémon manipulating the will of its adversaries and turning them into puppets of its own.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokémon that feeds on grass and berries.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: When attacked, they form a wall with their shieldlike faces to protect their young.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: When they lined up side by side, no foe could break through. They shielded their young in that way.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: When attacked, they form a wall. Their rock-hard faces serve to protect them from the attacks.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: When they lined up side by side, no foe could break through. They shielded their young in that way.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When they lined up side by side, no foe could break through. They shielded their young in that way.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokémon that feeds on grass and berries.
pokedex_entries.Sun: While it can guard against any sort of attack from the front, it is left without recourse when attacked from behind.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It lived in the same environments as Rampardos. Their fossils have been found together— seemingly from after they’d fought to the finish.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: The bones of its face are huge and hard, so they were mistaken for its spine until after this Pokémon was successfully restored.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: This Pokémon is from roughly 100 million years ago. Its terrifyingly tough face is harder than steel.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokémon that feeds on grass and berries.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: When attacked, they form a wall with their shield-like faces to protect their young.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Its face is sturdy—as strong as diamond—and this hardness offers a very stable defense. Much about this species is still unknown, such as its natural habitat.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: While its movements out of water are sluggish, it can swim as fast as any FEEBAS.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: A river dammed by BIBAREL will never overflow its banks, which is appreciated by people nearby.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It busily makes its nest with stacks of branches and roots it has cut up with its sharp incisors.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: A river dammed by Bibarel will never overflow its banks, which is appreciated by people nearby.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It busily makes its nest with stacks of branches and roots it has cut up with its sharp incisors.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: While its movements out of water are sluggish, it can swim as fast as any Feebas.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Bibarel fur repels water and is also a fantastic material for heat retention. These Pokémon create dams on rivers to live in.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: A comparison revealed that BIDOOF’s front teeth grow at the same rate as RATTATA’s.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It lives in groups by the water. It chews up boulders and trees around its nest with its incisors.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: A comparison revealed that Bidoof’s front teeth grow at the same rate as Rattata’s.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Bidoof has an unsophisticated face and is rarely flustered by anything. There have been incidents involving Bidoof sauntering into villages and gnawing on the houses without a single care.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It looks as if it is always crying. It is actually adjusting its body’s fluid levels by eliminating excess.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It prefers arid environments. It leaks water from its eyes to adjust its body’s fluid levels.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It prefers an arid atmosphere. It leaks water that looks like tears when adjusting its moisture level.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: In order to adjust the level of fluids in its body, it exudes water from its eyes. This makes it appear to be crying.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It prefers an arid atmosphere. It leaks water that looks like tears when adjusting its moisture level.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It prefers arid environments. It leaks water from its eyes to adjust its body’s fluid levels.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It prefers an arid atmosphere. It leaks water that looks like tears when adjusting its moisture level.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It does not deal well with water, so it lives in dry locales. Since its surroundings tend to lack greenery, it stands out noticeably.
pokedex_entries.Moon: From its eyes, it can expel excess moisture from its body. This liquid is similar in composition to human sweat.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It discharges moisture from its eyes, making it look like it’s crying—apparently an effective way of getting enemies to let down their guard.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: If its body gets too damp, it will die. So, in a process reminiscent of sweating, its eyes expel moisture.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It expels both sweat and tears from its eyes. The sweat is a little salty, while the tears have a slight bitterness.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon lives in dry, rocky areas. As its green spheres dry out, their dull luster increases.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It looks as if it is always crying. It is actually adjusting its body’s fluid levels by eliminating excess.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It prefers arid environments. It leaks water from its eyes to adjust its body’s fluid levels.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Its tears elicit sympathy from those who see them, but do not be deceived! This expulsion of body water is merely a physiological mechanism for keeping itself in good health.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: In order to adjust the level of fluids in its body, it exudes water from its eyes. This makes it appear to be crying.
pokedex_entries.Violet: From its eyes, it can expel excess moisture from its body. This liquid is similar in composition to human sweat.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: One caused a news sensation when it was dug up at a construction site after a 2,000-year sleep.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It can summon rain clouds. People long ago revered it as the bringer of plentiful harvests.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It brought rains by opening portals to another world. It was revered as a bringer of plentiful harvests.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Ancient people believed that petitioning BRONZONG for rain was the way to make crops grow.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It brought rains by opening portals to another world. It was revered as a bringer of plentiful harvests.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: In ages past, this Pokémon was revered as a bringer of rain. It was found buried in the ground.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: In ages past, this Pokémon was revered as a bringer of rain. It was found buried in the ground.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Some believe it to be a deity that summons rain clouds. When angered, it lets out a warning cry that rings out like the tolling of a bell.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Many scientists suspect that this Pokémon originated outside the Galar region, based on the patterns on its body.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: One caused a media storm when it was dug up at a construction site after a 2,000-year sleep.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It can summon rain clouds. People long ago revered it as the bringer of plentiful harvests.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Some believe that its bell-like cry opens holes to another world. It has been revered as a deity since ancient times.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: In ages past, this Pokémon was revered as a bringer of rain. It was found buried in the ground.
pokedex_entries.Violet: It brought rains by opening portals to another world. It was revered as a bringer of plentiful harvests.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: X-ray photos were taken to check its body structure. Nothing appeared, however.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: There are researchers who believe this Pokémon reflected like a mirror in the distant past.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Ancient people believed that the pattern on BRONZOR’s back contained a mysterious power.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: There are researchers who believe this Pokémon reflected like a mirror in the distant past.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: They are found in ancient tombs. The patterns on their backs are said to be imbued with mysterious power.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzor’s back contained a mysterious power.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It appears in ancient ruins. The pattern on its body doesn’t come from any culture in the Galar region, so it remains shrouded in mystery.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Polishing Bronzor to a shine makes its surface reflect the truth, according to common lore. Be that as it may, Bronzor hates being polished.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Implements shaped like Bronzor were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown whether they are related.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: X-ray photos were taken to check its body structure, but nothing was seen.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Floats using a mysterious energy. The pattern engraved upon its back is held as sacred and can sometimes be found in imagery from ancient cemeteries and other such timeworn places.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzor’s back contained a mysterious power.
pokedex_entries.Violet: They are found in ancient tombs. The patterns on their backs are said to be imbued with mysterious power.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It lives alongside clear ponds. It scatters pollen that induces harsh sneezing and runny noses.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Sensitive to changing temperature, the bud is said to bloom when it feels the sun’s warm touch.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: When it feels the sun’s warm touch, it opens its bud to release pollen. It lives alongside clear pools.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Sensitive to changing temperature, the bud is said to bloom when it feels the sun’s warm touch.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Sensitive to changing temperatures, the bud blooms when it’s warm, releasing toxic pollen.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When it feels the sun’s warm touch, it opens its bud to release pollen. It lives alongside clear pools.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The pollen it releases contains poison. If this Pokémon is raised on clean water, the poison’s toxicity is increased.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon is highly sensitive to temperature changes. When its bud starts to open, that means spring is right around the corner.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It lives alongside clear ponds. It scatters pollen that induces harsh sneezing and runny noses.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: When the sun’s light strengthens, the bud atop this Pokémon’s head opens. This is a sign to the people that the harsh winter is over, and the season of budding has begun.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It has a flotation sac that is like an inflatable collar. It floats on water with its head out.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It inflates its flotation sac, keeping its face above water in order to watch for prey movement.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: When air fills the flotation sac on its neck, the sac balloons like an inner tube. This Pokémon floats with its head out of the water.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It moves freely in the water by spinning its forked tail for propulsion. The resemblance to the screw of a steamboat is coincidental.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.
pokedex_entries.Violet: It inflates its flotation sac, keeping its face above water in order to watch for prey movement.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It slams foes by sharply uncoiling its rolled ears. It stings enough to make a grown-up cry in pain.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: When it senses danger, it perks up its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into its fur.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: You can tell how it feels by the way it rolls its ears. When it’s scared, both ears are rolled up.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: By extending its rolled-up ears and striking the ground, it can bound so high it surprises itself.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When it senses danger, it perks up its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into its fur.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its arms and legs are weak, but when it rolls its ears up tight and then unleashes them with its full force, it can smash boulders to dust.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: The reason it keeps one ear rolled up is so it can launch a swift counterattack if it’s attacked by an enemy.
pokedex_entries.Sword: If both of Buneary’s ears are rolled up, something is wrong with its body or mind. It’s a sure sign the Pokémon is in need of care.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Buneary can attack by rolling up their ears and then striking with the force created by unrolling them. This attack becomes stronger with training.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It slams foes by sharply uncoiling its rolled ears. It stings enough to make a grown-up cry in pain.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: When it senses danger, it perks up its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into its fur.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: My hypothesis as to why Buneary rolls up its ears is that its hearing is far too keen. I surmise that the Pokémon protects its hearing by limiting the sound that may enter its ears.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Even if it is born where there are no cocooning materials, it somehow always ends up with a cloak.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It covers itself with a cloak to shelter from the cold. When it’s hot, its cloak is thinner.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Even if it is born where there are no cocooning materials, it somehow always ends up with a cloak.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: If its cloak is even slightly damaged, Burmy will immediately repair it with whatever is close at hand. The Pokémon within the cloak is scrawny and vulnerable to the cold.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Hanging from branches using its tentacles, it looks like a plant. It awaits prey, mouth wide open.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It walks around on its tentacles in search of a tree branch where it can dangle down and ambush prey.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Using its tentacles to lash itself to trees, it lies in wait for prey, luring it close with sweet-smelling drool.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat its prey.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Using its tentacles to hang from branches, it looks like a plant when it is not moving. It awaits prey with its mouth wide open.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Though this is a plant Pokémon, it has a gluttonous and unruly temperament. Carnivine attacks its prey with its cavernous maw wide open.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It keeps rhythm by flicking its tail feathers like a metronome. It imitates human speech.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its tongue is just like a human’s. As a result, it can cleverly mimic human speech.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It mimics the cries of other Pokémon to trick them into thinking it’s one of them. This way they won’t attack it.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its tongue is just like a human’s. As a result, it can cleverly mimic human speech.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It mimics the cries of other Pokémon to trick them into thinking it’s one of them. This way they won’t attack it.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: They can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It keeps rhythm by flicking its tail feathers like a metronome. It also imitates human speech.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: A versatile performer skilled in the imitation of human speech. It is said that older, more experienced Chatot can even understand the meaning of the words they mimic.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It blooms during times of strong sunlight. It tries to make up for everything it endured as a bud.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It is docile as a bud, but turns cheerful when it blooms. It folds back into a bud if sunlight wanes.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun’s rays with its whole body.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: During times of strong sunlight, its bud blooms, its petals open fully, and it becomes very active.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun’s rays with its whole body.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: During times of strong sunlight, its bud blooms, its petals open fully, and it becomes very active.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun’s rays with its whole body.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It blooms during times of strong sunlight. The Pokémon tries to make up for everything it endured as a bud.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It is docile as a bud and turns cheerful when it blooms. It folds back into a bud if sunlight wanes.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Motionless, save for the occasional quiver. A rich array of Pokémon can be found gathered around it, drawn by the scent exuded from Cherrim’s folded petals.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: The small ball holds the nutrients needed for evolution. Apparently, it is very sweet and tasty.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Sunlight colors it red. When the small ball is drained of nutrients, it shrivels to herald evolution.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: The small ball is not only filled with nutrients, it is also tasty. STARLY try to peck it off.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It evolves by sucking the energy out of the small ball where it had been storing nutrients.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: The small ball is not only filled with nutrients, it is also tasty. Starly try to peck it off.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Sunlight colors it red. When the small ball is drained of nutrients, it shrivels to herald evolution.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It evolves by sucking the energy out of the small ball where it had been storing nutrients.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It nimbly dashes about to avoid getting pecked by bird Pokémon that would love to make off with its small, nutrient-rich storage ball.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The deeper a Cherubi’s red, the more nutrients it has stockpiled in its body. And the sweeter and tastier its small ball!
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: The small ball holds the nutrients needed for evolution. Apparently, it is very sweet and tasty.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Sunlight colors it red. When the small ball is drained of nutrients and shriveled, evolution is near.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Once the fruit growing alongside the main body is large and plump, Cherubi will use the nutrients within to evolve. The fruit then detaches, becoming nourishment for other creatures.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It agilely scales sheer cliffs to live atop craggy mountains. Its fire is put out when it sleeps.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Its fiery rear end is fueled by gas made in its belly. Even rain can’t extinguish the fire.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It is very agile. Before going to sleep, it extinguishes the flame on its tail to prevent fires.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It is very agile. Before going to sleep, it extinguishes the flame on its tail to prevent fires.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its fiery rear end is fueled by gas made in its belly. Even rain can’t extinguish the fire.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It agilely scales sheer cliffs to live atop craggy mountains. Its fire is put out when it sleeps.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Its fiery rear end is fueled by gas made in its belly. Even rain can’t extinguish the fire.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Full of vigor and always in high spirits. It was once known by the name “Lantern-Tail” and feared as some kind of apparition.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It emits cries by agitating an orb at the back of its throat. It moves with flouncing hops.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Each time it hops, it makes a ringing sound. It deafens foes by emitting high-frequency cries.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It emits high-frequency cries that people can’t hear. Once it starts, it can cry for an awfully long time.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Each time it hops, it makes a ringing sound. It deafens foes by emitting high-frequency cries.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It emits cries by agitating an orb at the back of its throat. It moves with flouncing hops.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Each time it hops, it makes a ringing sound. It deafens foes by emitting high-frequency cries.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This Pokémon gave me an excruciating headache when it seemingly cried out without making a sound. Perhaps there are some sounds that the human ear is simply incapable of hearing.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: A Pokémon formed by three others. It busily carries sweet floral honey to VESPIQUEN.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It collects and delivers honey to its colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: The trio is together from birth. It constantly gathers honey from flowers to please VESPIQUEN.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: At night, COMBEE sleep in a group of about a thousand, packed closely together in a lump.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: The trio is together from birth. It constantly gathers honey from flowers to please Vespiquen.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: This Pokémon is a set of three. When they sleep, they gather up and form a giant hive of 100 Combee.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The trio is together from birth. It constantly gathers honey from flowers to please Vespiquen.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It collects and delivers honey to its colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The members of the trio spend all their time together. Each one has a slightly different taste in nectar.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It ceaselessly gathers nectar from sunrise to sundown, all for the sake of Vespiquen and the swarm.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Three Pokémon joined to become one. It busily carries sweet nectar to Vespiquen.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: They collect and deliver honey to their colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: They swear fealty to a queen Pokémon and work diligently to gather nectar. Each swarm produces a different flavor of honey.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: At night, Combee sleep in a group of about a hundred, packed closely together in a lump.
pokedex_entries.Violet: The trio is together from birth. It constantly gathers nectar from flowers to please Vespiquen.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its skull is as hard as iron.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It was resurrected from an iron ball-like fossil. It downs prey with its head butts.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with head butts.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: CRANIDOS toughen up their already rock-hard heads by headbutting one another.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with head butts.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It was resurrected from an iron ball-like fossil. It downs prey with its headbutts.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with headbutts.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It lived in jungles around a hundred million years ago. It used its skillful headbutts to combat Aerodactyl.
pokedex_entries.Moon: In rock layers where Cranidos fossils are found, the fossilized trunks of trees snapped in two are also often found.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: A primeval Pokémon, it possesses a hard and sturdy skull, lacking any intelligence within.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its hard skull is its distinguishing feature. It snapped trees by headbutting them, and then it fed on their ripe berries.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its skull is as hard as iron.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It was resurrected from an iron-ball-like fossil. It downs prey with its headbutts.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: An incredibly rare sight. They duel each other by ramming their heads together, and the resulting sound echoes throughout the area like the pealing of a bell.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: On nights around the quarter moon, the aurora from its tail extends and undulates beautifully.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Those who sleep holding CRESSELIA’s feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: On nights around the quarter moon, the aurora from its tail extends and undulates beautifully.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Those who sleep holding Cresselia’s feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: When it flies, it releases shiny particles from its veil-like wings. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Cresselia is reminiscent of the crescent moon. It leaves a brilliant line of light in its wake as it flies across the night sky. I daresay it resembles the heavenly maiden who created the Milky Way.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Inflating its poison sacs, it makes an eerie blubbering sound for intimidation.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It rarely fights fairly, but that is strictly to ensure survival. It is popular as a mascot.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Fluid squeezed from its finger, albeit poisonous, is a significant ingredient in remedies for lower-back pain.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Fluid squeezed from its finger, albeit poisonous, is a significant ingredient in remedies for lower back pain.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It rarely fights fairly, but that is strictly to ensure survival. It is popular as a mascot.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It makes frightening noises with its poison-filled cheek sacs. When opponents flinch, Croagunk hits them with a poison jab.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Once diluted, its poison becomes medicinal. This Pokémon came into popularity after a pharmaceutical company chose it as a mascot.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It inflates its poison sacs and makes a blubbering sound to intimidate foes.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: A poison wielder with a dastardly personality. Despite such qualities, this species is afforded a measure of popularity due to its peculiar cry and comical features.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.
pokedex_entries.Violet: It rarely fights fairly, but that is strictly to ensure survival. It is popular as a mascot.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Folklore has it that on moonless nights, this Pokémon will make people see horrific nightmares.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: To protect itself, it afflicts those around it with nightmares. However, it means no harm.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It chases people and Pokémon from its territory by causing them to experience deep, nightmarish slumbers.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: To protect itself, it afflicts those around it with nightmares. However, it means no harm.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It chases people and Pokémon from its territory by causing them to experience deep, nightmarish slumbers.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of a new moon.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Folklore has it that on moonless nights, this Pokémon will make people see horrific nightmares.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: On a moonless night, a strange incident occurred in which every one of a village’s inhabitants suffered nightmares. The villagers attested that Darkrai appeared before them in these nightmares.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: A Pokémon spoken of in legend. It is said that time began moving when DIALGA was born.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: A legendary Pokémon of Sinnoh. It is said that time flows when DIALGA’s heart beats.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: This Pokémon completely controls the flow of time. It uses its power to travel at will through the past and future.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: A legendary Pokémon of Sinnoh. It is said that time flows when Dialga’s heart beats.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: A Pokémon spoken of in legend. It is said that time began moving when Dialga was born.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: This Pokémon is spoken of in legend. It is said that time began moving when Dialga was born.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This Pokémon is revered as a deity in Hisuian legend. The birth of Dialga was what caused the vast river of time to begin flowing in our world.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Its body is encased in a sturdy shell. Its head rotates 180 degrees, eliminating blind spots.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Possessing a sturdy build, it takes pride in its strength, taking down foes without using toxins.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It attacks people and Pokémon that cross the desert. This has only furthered its bad reputation.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Possessing a sturdy build, it takes pride in its strength, taking down foes without using toxins.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It takes pride in its strength. Even though it can tear foes apart, it finishes them off with powerful poison.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It takes pride in its strength. Even though it can tear foes apart, it finishes them off with powerful poison.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Its poison is potent, but it rarely sees use. This Pokémon prefers to use physical force instead, going on rampages with its car-crushing strength.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It’s so vicious that it’s called the Sand Demon. Yet when confronted by Hippowdon, Drapion keeps a low profile and will never pick a fight.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Its body is encased in a sturdy shell. Its head rotates 180 degrees, eliminating blind spots.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Has a brutish, ferocious temperament. With immense strength and a sturdy shell off which swords will bounce, it rampages about and wreaks havoc.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It’s drowzy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It carries people and Pokémon when it flies. But since it only drifts, it can end up anywhere.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: At dusk, swarms of them are carried aloft on winds. When noticed, they suddenly vanish.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It can generate and release gas within its body. That’s how it can control the altitude of its drift.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: At dusk, swarms of them are carried aloft on winds. When noticed, they suddenly vanish.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: They carry people and Pokémon, but the wind can catch them, so there can’t be a fixed destination.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It carries people and Pokémon when it flies. But since it only drifts, it can end up anywhere.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It’s drowsy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.
pokedex_entries.Sun: There was once an incident in which a man took a trip riding a Drifblim, only to go missing.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Even while under careful observation, large flocks of Drifblim flying at dusk will inexplicably disappear from view.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: There’s a rumor that if you catch a Drifblim floating on the wind at dusk, you’ll be carried away to the afterlife.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: The raw material for the gas inside its body is souls. When its body starts to deflate, it’s thought to carry away people and Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Some say this Pokémon is a collection of souls burdened with regrets, silently drifting through the dusk.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It grabs people and Pokémon and carries them off somewhere. Where do they go? Nobody knows.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: They’re drowsy in daytime but fly off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It carries people and Pokémon when it flies. But since it only drifts, it can end up anywhere.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It drifts along at dusk, perfectly silent. Its transient, melancholy aspect touches some people deeply—every so often, one will come upon a song or poem devoted to Drifblim.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: It can generate and release gas within its body. That’s how it can control the altitude of its drift.
pokedex_entries.Violet: They carry people and Pokémon, but the wind can catch them, so there can’t be a fixed destination.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: A Pokémon formed by the spirits of people and Pokémon. It loves damp, humid seasons.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It tugs on the hands of children to steal them away. However, it gets pulled around instead.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Because of the way it floats aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a “Signpost for Wandering Spirits.”
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It is whispered that any child who mistakes DRIFLOON for a balloon and holds on to it could wind up missing.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Because of the way it floats aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a “Signpost for Wandering Spirits.”
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: These Pokémon are called the “Signpost for Wandering Spirits.” Children holding them sometimes vanish.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: A Pokémon formed by the spirits of people and Pokémon. It loves damp, humid seasons.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: These Pokémon are called the “Signpost for Wandering Spirits.” Children holding them sometimes vanish.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Stories go that it grabs the hands of small children and drags them away to the afterlife. It dislikes heavy children.
pokedex_entries.Moon: If for some reason its body bursts, its soul spills out with a screaming sound.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its round body is stuffed with souls and expands each time it leads someone away.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Wandering souls gathered together to form this Pokémon. When trying to make friends with children, Drifloon grabs them by the hand.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Perhaps seeking company, it approaches children. However, it often quickly runs away again when the children play too roughly with it.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The gathering of many souls gave rise to this Pokémon. During humid seasons, they seem to appear in abundance.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It is a Pokémon formed by the spirits of people and Pokémon. It loves damp, humid seasons.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It tugs on the hands of children to spirit them away. However, it gets pulled around instead.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Said to lure away young children and carry them off to the afterlife. Some whisper that Drifloon are formed of reincarnated human souls, but these rumors are as yet unconfirmed.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: It is whispered that any child who mistakes Drifloon for a balloon and holds on to it could wind up missing.
pokedex_entries.Violet: Because of the way it floats aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a “signpost for wandering spirits.”

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: This feared Pokémon is said to travel to worlds unknown. Some even believe that it takes lost spirits along with it.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and guide them home.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.
pokedex_entries.Sword: At the bidding of transmissions from the spirit world, it steals people and Pokémon away. No one knows whether it has a will of its own.
pokedex_entries.Shield: With the mouth on its belly, Dusknoir swallows its target whole. The soul is the only thing eaten— Dusknoir disgorges the body before departing.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Comes to those whose lives have come to an end and escorts their souls to the afterlife. Known to mistakenly take the souls of those who yet have life left in them, albeit rarely.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Heedless of enemy attacks, it closes in, shoves its tails onto the foe, then looses high voltage.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Heedless of enemy attacks, it closes in, shoves its tails onto the foe, then looses high voltage.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The instant it presses the tips of its tails onto an opponent, it sends over 20,000 volts of electricity into the foe.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It pushes the tips of its tails against its foes and then lets loose a high-voltage current. Its foes are burned to a crisp in an instant.
pokedex_entries.Moon: When it gets excited, it thumps its chest. With every thud, thunder roars and electric sparks shower all around.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It grips its tail, which spews electricity, and then beats down opponents with the power of its electrified fist.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: A single Electivire can provide enough electricity for all the buildings in a big city for a year.
pokedex_entries.Sword: The amount of electrical energy this Pokémon produces is proportional to the rate of its pulse. The voltage jumps while Electivire is battling.
pokedex_entries.Shield: In terms of electrical-energy output, Electivire is one of the best among all Electric Pokémon. It discharges high-voltage currents from its tails.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of electricity.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Its evolution was induced by an unusual item, and its electrical output rises along with its heart rate. From its tails, it can unleash an electric current measuring 20,000 volts.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It swims as fast as a jet boat. The edges of its wings are sharp and can slice apart drifting ice.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: If anyone were to hurt its pride, it would slash them with wings that can cleave through an ice floe.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It avoids unnecessary disputes, but it will decimate anything that threatens its pride.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: If anyone were to hurt its pride, it would slash them with wings that can cleave through an ice floe.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It swims as fast as a jet boat. The edges of its wings are sharp and can slice apart drifting ice.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It swims as fast as a jet boat. The edges of its wings are sharp and can slice apart drifting ice.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Since ancient times, it has been revered by the people of Hisui, who call it the Master of the Waves. Its wings are a match for even master-crafted blades.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: After long exposure to sunlight, the patterns on its tail fins shine vividly when darkness arrives.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: The way its two tail fins flutter while it swims has earned it the nickname “BEAUTIFLY of the Sea.”
pokedex_entries.Platinum: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Swimming and fluttering its two tail fins, it looks like a BEAUTIFLY. At night, the patterns on its tail fins softly shine.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: After long exposure to sunlight, the patterns on its tail fins shine vividly when darkness arrives.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It absorbs sunlight with the pink areas of its skin, which then shine. This appears to be a form of camouflage.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Its double tail fins propel its energetic jumps. When it breaks the surface of the sea, Wingull swoop down to grab it on the fly.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: When night falls, their pink patterns begin to shine. They’re popular with divers, so there are resorts that feed them to keep them close.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It lures in prey with its shining tail fins. It stays near the surface during the day and moves to the depths when night falls.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: After long exposure to sunlight, the patterns on its tail fins shine vividly when darkness arrives.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: The way its two tail fins flutter while it swims has earned it the nickname Beautifly of the Sea.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: What a gorgeous sight this Pokémon is as it swims with its long, pink-painted caudal fins fluttering behind it. Finneon’s beautiful appearance has led to its nickname: “finery fish.”
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.
pokedex_entries.Violet: It absorbs sunlight with the pink areas of its skin, which then shine. This appears to be a form of camouflage.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It is a common sight around fishing ports. It is known to rescue people and carry off prey.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: With its flotation sac inflated, it can carry people on its back. It deflates the sac before it dives.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It is a common sight around fishing ports. It is known to rescue people and carry off prey.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. Floatzel carries people as if it were a rubber raft.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Has a long, rather splendid flotation sac, which prevents Floatzel from drowning even in stormy seas. One might glimpse this species around fishing hamlets from time to time.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: With its flotation sac inflated, it can carry people on its back. It deflates the sac before it dives.
pokedex_entries.Violet: It is a common sight around fishing ports. It is known to rescue people and help fishers carry what they caught.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It freezes foes with an icy breath nearly -60 degrees F. What seems to be its body is actually hollow.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It freezes prey by blowing its -58 degrees F breath. It is said to then secretly display its prey.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Legends in snowy regions say that a woman who was lost on an icy mountain was reborn as FROSLASS.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Legends in snowy regions say that a woman who was lost on an icy mountain was reborn as FROSLASS
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It freezes prey by blowing its -58 degrees F breath. It is said to then secretly display its prey.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It freezes foes with an icy breath nearly -60 degrees Fahrenheit. What seems to be its body is actually hollow.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Legends in snowy regions say that a woman who was lost on an icy mountain was reborn as Froslass.
pokedex_entries.Sun: When it finds humans or Pokémon it likes, it freezes them and takes them to its chilly den, where they become decorations.
pokedex_entries.Moon: The soul of a woman lost on a snowy mountain possessed an icicle, becoming this Pokémon. The food it most relishes is the souls of men.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It freezes hikers who have come to climb snowy mountains and carries them back to its home. It only goes after men it thinks are handsome.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It’s said that on nights of terrible blizzards, it comes down to human settlements. If you hear it knocking at your door, do not open it!
pokedex_entries.Sword: After a woman met her end on a snowy mountain, her regrets lingered on. From them, this Pokémon was born. Its favorite food is frozen souls.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It spits out cold air of nearly −60 degrees Fahrenheit to freeze its quarry. It brings frozen prey back to its lair and neatly lines them up.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It freezes foes with an icy breath that is nearly −60 degrees Fahrenheit. What seems to be its body is actually hollow.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: A Pokémon inhabited by the soul of a woman who died bearing a grudge in the snowy mountains. Legends of Froslass placing deathly curses on misbehaving men send shivers down my spine.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: When it finds humans or Pokémon it likes, it freezes them and takes them to its chilly den, where they become decorations.
pokedex_entries.Violet: It freezes prey by blowing its −58 degree Fahrenheit breath. It is said to then secretly display its prey.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: There is a long-held belief that medicine made from its scales will heal even incurable illnesses.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It habitually digs up and hoards gems in its nest. Its loot is constantly targeted by thieves.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: As it digs to expand its nest, it habitually digs up gems that it then hoards in its nest.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: As it digs to expand its nest, it habitually digs up gems that it then hoards in its nest.
pokedex_entries.Sun: In rare cases, it molts and sheds its scales. Medicine containing its scales as an ingredient will make a weary body feel invigorated.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Shiny objects are its passion. It can be found in its cave, scarcely moving, its gaze fixed on the jewels it’s amassed or Carbink it has caught.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It loves shiny things. When it finds a Sableye trying to catch a Carbink, Gabite becomes furiously angry and attacks the Sableye.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It sheds its skin and gradually grows larger. Its scales can be ground into a powder and used as raw materials for traditional medicine.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon emits ultrasonic waves from a protrusion on either side of its head to probe pitch-dark caves.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Jewels are buried in the caves these Pokémon nest in, but you’ll be torn apart by claws and fangs the moment you enter one of these caves.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: There is a long-held belief that medicine made from its scales will heal incurable illnesses.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It habitually digs up and hoards gems in its nest. Its loot is constantly targeted by thieves.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Though Gabite are usually of a violent disposition, when I gave one a glass bead it had been eyeing covetously, it suddenly became quite docile.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: In rare cases, it molts and sheds its scales. Medicine containing its scales as an ingredient will make a weary body feel invigorated.
pokedex_entries.Violet: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: When trying to protect someone, it extends its elbows as if they were swords and fights savagely.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: When trying to protect someone, it extends its elbows as if they were swords and fights savagely.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.
pokedex_entries.Sword: True to its honorable-warrior image, it uses the blades on its elbows only in defense of something or someone.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Sharply attuned to others’ wishes for help, this Pokémon seeks out those in need and aids them in battle.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using the extending swords on its elbows.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: The blades extending from its elbows are sharper than the finest swords. Its swordsmanship, albeit self-taught, is astonishingly impressive.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: When trying to protect someone, it extends its elbows as if they were swords and fights savagely.
pokedex_entries.Violet: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: When it folds up its body and extends its wings, it looks like a jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It flies at speeds equal to a jet fighter plane. It never allows its prey to escape.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It is said that when one runs at high speed, its wings create blades of wind that can fell nearby trees.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its body is covered in fine scales that reduce drag, enabling it to fly at high speeds.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It is said that when one runs at high speed, its wings create blades of wind that can fell nearby trees.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When it folds up its body and extends its wings, it looks like a jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It flies at speeds equal to a jet fighter plane. It never allows its prey to escape.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It can fly at speeds rivaling jet planes. It dives into flocks of bird Pokémon and gulps the entire flock down whole.
pokedex_entries.Moon: The protuberances on its head serve as sensors. It can even detect distant prey.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It flies at the speed of sound while searching for prey, and it has midair battles with Salamence as the two compete for food.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its fine scales don’t just reduce wind resistance—their sharp edges also cause injury to any opponent who attacks it.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Garchomp makes its home in volcanic mountains. It flies through the sky as fast as a jet airplane, hunting down as much prey as it can.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Garchomp is fast both underground and above. It can bring down prey and return to its den before its body has chilled from being outside.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: When it folds up its body and extends its wings, it looks like a jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It flies at speeds equal to a jet fighter plane. It never allows its prey to escape.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Soars across the heavens at blinding speed—a magnificent sight! It has a feral disposition. Utmost caution is required if one meets a Garchomp out in the wilds.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: It is said that when one runs at high speed, its wings create blades of wind that can fell nearby trees.
pokedex_entries.Violet: The protuberances on its head serve as sensors. It can even detect distant prey.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It has a pliable body without any bones. If any part of its body is torn off, it grows right back.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It apparently had a huge shell for protection in ancient times. It lives in shallow tidal pools.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Long ago, its entire back was shielded with a sturdy shell. There are traces of it left in its cells.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: When its natural enemy attacks, it oozes purple fluid and escapes.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Long ago, its entire back was shielded with a sturdy shell. There are traces of it left in its cells.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When its natural enemy attacks, it oozes purple fluid and escapes.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It apparently had a huge shell for protection in ancient times. It lives in shallow tidal pools.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It has a pliable body without any bones. If any part of its body is torn off, it grows right back.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It apparently had a huge shell for protection in ancient times. It lives in shallow tidal pools.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Eats beach sand for nourishment. Should one Gastrodon encounter another of a different color, a fierce battle will inevitably ensue.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It once lived in the tropics. To avoid the cold, it lives in caves warmed by geothermal heat.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It attacks using its huge mouth. While its attacks are powerful, it hurts itself out of clumsiness, too.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It nests in horizontal holes warmed by geothermal heat. Foes who get too close can expect to be pounced on and bitten.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It attacks using its huge mouth. While its attacks are powerful, it hurts itself out of clumsiness, too.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It nests in horizontal holes warmed by geothermal heat. Foes who get too close can expect to be pounced on and bitten.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It lives in caves warmed by geothermal heat. Even so, when the weather gets cold, it will huddle close with others of its kind.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It reacts to anything that moves—flies right at it and bites it. Sometimes it injures itself, but it doesn’t care too much.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its original home is an area much hotter than Alola. If you’re planning to live with one, your heating bill will soar.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Gible prefers to stay in narrow holes in the sides of caves heated by geothermal energy. This way, Gible can stay warm even during a blizzard.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Gible attacks anything that moves, and it drags whatever it catches into the crevice that is its lair. Despite the big mouth, Gible’s stomach is small.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It once lived in the tropics. To avoid the cold, it lives in caves warmed by geothermal heat.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It nests in caves untouched by sunlight. Its sharp teeth may fall out when worn away or after an impact, but they regrow within a few days.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.
pokedex_entries.Violet: It nests in horizontal holes warmed by geothermal heat. Foes who get too close can expect to be pounced on and bitten.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: A Pokémon that is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours. It appears in an ancient cemetery.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: This Pokémon is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours, where common knowledge is distorted and strange.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: This Pokémon is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours, where common knowledge is distorted and strange.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: A Pokémon that is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours. It appears in an ancient cemetery.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: There is one Hisuian verse that tells of a powerful light creating a deep shadow. I imagine that this deep shadow is Giratina.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: As a protective technique, it can completely freeze its fur to make its hairs stand like needles.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: By controlling its body heat, it can freeze the atmosphere around it to make a diamond-dust flurry.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It causes small ice crystals to form by lowering the temperature of the surrounding atmosphere.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: By controlling its body heat, it can freeze the atmosphere around it to make a diamond-dust flurry.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It lowers its body heat to freeze its fur. The hairs then become like needles it can fire.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: By controlling its body heat, it can freeze the atmosphere around it to make a diamond-dust flurry.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It lowers its body heat to freeze its fur. The hairs then become like needles it can fire.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It can control its body temperature at will. This enables it to freeze the moisture in the atmosphere, creating flurries of diamond dust.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It freezes its fur into icicles, spiky and sharp, and tackles its prey.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It protects itself by freezing its fur into sharp needles. It can drop its body temperature below –75 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It can instantaneously freeze any moisture that’s around it, creating ice pellets to shoot at its prey.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Any who become captivated by the beauty of the snowfall that Glaceon creates will be frozen before they know it.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The coldness emanating from Glaceon causes powdery snow to form, making it quite a popular Pokémon at ski resorts.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: As a defense mechanism, it can completely freeze its fur to make its hairs stand out like needles.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Glaceon is able to lower its body temperature very quickly. It freezes the atmosphere, creating diamond dust that glitters like gems while it flutters and dances around.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: It can control its body temperature at will. This enables it to freeze the moisture in the atmosphere, creating flurries of diamond dust.
pokedex_entries.Violet: It lowers its body heat to freeze its fur. The hairs then become like needles it can fire.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: With its sharp glare, it puts foes in a mild hypnotic state. It is a very fickle Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It hides its spiteful tendency of hooking its claws into the nose of its Trainer if it isn’t fed.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: When it’s happy, GLAMEOW demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It hides its spiteful tendency of hooking its claws into the nose of its Trainer if it isn’t fed.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When it’s happy, Glameow demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: With its sharp glare, it puts foes in a mild hypnotic state. It is a very fickle Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Bewitches humans with its helical tail and piercing gaze. Its hidden claws are quite sharp as well, making this Pokémon an exceedingly tricky opponent if antagonized.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!
pokedex_entries.Platinum: If it succeeds in catching even a faint breeze properly, it can circle the globe without flapping once.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: If it succeeds in catching even a faint breeze properly, it can circle the globe without flapping once.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It dances silently through the sky. When it approaches prey, it can land a critical hit in an instant.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, Gliscor swoops!
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It glides soundlessly on pitch-black wings and sinks sharp fangs into the throat of its prey. It takes on a look of satisfaction once it has entirely drained its prey of blood.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It lives along water in forests. In the daytime, it leaves the forest to sunbathe its treed shell.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: The shell is hardened soil. Some Pokémon come to peck the berries growing on the trees on its back.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: A GROTLE that lives in the forest is said to have its own secret springwater.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It lives along water in forests. In the daytime, it leaves the forest to sunbathe its treed shell.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It lives along water in forests. In the daytime, it leaves the forest to sunbathe the trees on its shell.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Its shell is hardened soil. Some Pokémon come to peck the berries growing on the trees on its back.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Appears where there is clean spring water. The fruit that grows on the shrubs on its shell is sweet, nutritious, and truly delicious.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It loves round white things. It carries an egg-shaped rock in imitation of CHANSEY.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It carries a round, egg-shaped rock in its belly pouch and gives the rock to its friends.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It likes to carry around a small rock. It may wander around others’ feet and cause them to stumble.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It carefully carries a round, white rock that it thinks is an egg. It’s bothered by how curly its hair looks.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It likes to carry around a small rock. It may wander around others’ feet and cause them to stumble.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It carries a round, egg-shaped rock in its belly pouch and gives the rock to its friends.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It carefully carries a round, white rock that it thinks is an egg. It’s bothered by how curly its hair looks.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It carries a round white rock in its belly pouch. If it gets along well with someone, it will sometimes give that person the rock.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It’s too small to lay eggs yet. As a surrogate, it searches out round white stones.
