pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Usually it’s a well-behaved Pokémon, but if you take its round rock away, it will cry and fuss and throw a big old tantrum.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: When it sees something round and white, Happiny puts it into the pouch on its stomach. It sometimes becomes overloaded and can’t move.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Mimicking Chansey, Happiny will place an egg- shaped stone in its belly pouch. Happiny will treasure this stone.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Happiny’s willing to lend its precious round stone to those it’s friendly with, but if the stone isn’t returned, Happiny will cry and throw a tantrum.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It loves round, white things. It carries an egg-shaped rock in imitation of Chansey.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It carries a round, egg-shaped rock in its belly pouch and gives the rock to its friends.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: In imitation of Chansey, it keeps a round stone tucked into its belly pouch and cherishes it dearly. It gets along well with children and will sometimes play house with them for fun.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: It carries a round, white rock in its belly pouch. If it gets along well with someone, it will sometimes give that person the rock.
pokedex_entries.Violet: It carefully carries a round, white rock that it thinks is an egg. It’s bothered by how curly its hair looks.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its body is made of rugged steel. However, it is partially melted in spots because of its own heat.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its body is made of rugged steel. However, it is partially melted in spots because of its own heat.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Stories tell of this Pokémon being birthed from the boiling magma within Mount Coronet. Its molten-steel body holds many mysteries.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It lives in arid places. Instead of perspiration, it expels grainy sand from its body.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It shuts its nostrils tight then travels through sand as if walking. They form colonies of around ten.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It shrouds itself in sand to ward off germs. It travels easily through the sands of the desert.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It shuts its nostrils tight then travels through sand as if walking. They form colonies of around ten.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It shuts its nostrils tight then travels through sand as if walking. They form colonies of around 10.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It lives in arid places. Instead of perspiration, it expels grainy sand from its body.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It moves through the sands with its mouth open, swallowing sand along with its prey. It gets rid of the sand by spouting it from its nose.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon is active during the day and passes the cold desert nights burrowed snugly into the sand.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It lives in arid places. Instead of perspiration, it expels grainy sand from its body.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Though large and languid, Hippopotas is difficult to detect due to its tendency to burrow into and lurk beneath the soil. When agitated or excited, it expels sand from its nostrils.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: It shuts its nostrils tight, then travels through sand as if walking. They form colonies of around 10.
pokedex_entries.Violet: It shrouds itself in sand to ward off germs. It travels easily through the sands of the desert.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Its huge mouth is almost seven feet across. It has enough power to completely crush a car.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It is surprisingly quick to anger. It holds its mouth agape as a display of its strength.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It brandishes its gaping mouth in a display of fearsome strength. It raises vast quantities of sand while attacking.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It is surprisingly quick to anger. It holds its mouth agape as a display of its strength.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It brandishes its gaping mouth in a display of fearsome strength. It raises vast quantities of sand while attacking.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Stones can get stuck in the ports on their bodies. Dwebble help dislodge such stones, so Hippowdon look after these Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Shield: When roused to violence by its rage, it spews out the quantities of sand it has swallowed and whips up a sandstorm.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Its huge mouth opens almost seven feet wide. It has enough power to completely crush a car.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Short-tempered and easily moved to violence. It whips up whirlwinds of sand to crush its foes’ spirits, then goes in for the attack.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: It is surprisingly quick to anger. It holds its mouth agape as a display of its strength.
pokedex_entries.Violet: It brandishes its gaping mouth in a display of fearsome strength. It raises vast quantities of sand while attacking.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Becoming active at night, it is known to swarm with numerous MURKROW in tow.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It makes its MURKROW cronies bring it food. It idles its time away, grooming itself in its nest.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: If one utters a deep cry, many MURKROW gather quickly. For this, it is called “Summoner of Night.”
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It is merciless by nature. It is said that it never forgives the mistakes of its MURKROW followers.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: If one utters a deep cry, many Murkrow gather quickly. For this, it is called “Summoner of Night.”
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: If one utters a deep cry, many Murkrow gather quickly. For this, it is called “Summoner of Night.”
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Becoming active at night, it is known to swarm with numerous Murkrow in tow.
pokedex_entries.Sun: A single cry from this nocturnal Pokémon, and more than a hundred of its Murkrow cronies will assemble.
pokedex_entries.Moon: If its Murkrow cronies fail to catch food for it, or if it feels they have betrayed it, it will hunt them down wherever they are and punish them.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It will absolutely not forgive failure from or betrayal by its goons. It has no choice in this if it wants to maintain the order of the flock.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its goons take care of most of the fighting for it. The only time it dirties its own hands is in delivering a final blow to finish off an opponent.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Becoming active at night, it is known to form flocks with numerous Murkrow in tow.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It makes its Murkrow cronies bring it food. It idles its time away, grooming itself in its nest.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: One cry from this Pokémon, and a murder of Murkrow come flying. At such times, one would think the curtain of night had fallen, plunging the world into jet-black darkness.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: It is merciless by nature. It is said that it never forgives the mistakes of its Murkrow followers.
pokedex_entries.Violet: A single cry from this nocturnal Pokémon, and more than 100 of its Murkrow cronies will assemble.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It uses a special kind of martial arts involving all its limbs. Its fire never goes out.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Its crown of fire is indicative of its fiery nature. It is beaten by none in terms of quickness.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It uses unique fighting moves with fire on its hands and feet. It will take on any opponent.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It uses unique fighting moves with fire on its hands and feet. It will take on any opponent.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its crown of fire is indicative of its fiery nature. It is beaten by none in terms of quickness.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It uses a special kind of martial arts involving all its limbs. Its fire never goes out.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Its crown of fire is indicative of its fiery nature. It is beaten by none in terms of quickness.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: A tall, hardy Pokémon with a dazzling appearance. It shrouds itself in flame and battles as if engaged in dance—truly a sight to behold.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It shakes its head back to front, causing its antennae to hit each other and sound like a xylophone.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It chats with others using the sounds of its colliding antennae. These sounds are fall hallmarks.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its legs are short. Whenever it stumbles, its stiff antennae clack with a xylophone-like sound.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its legs are short. Whenever it stumbles, its stiff antennae clack with a xylophone-like sound.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It chats with others using the sounds of its colliding antennae. These sounds are fall hallmarks.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It shakes its head back to front, causing its antennae to hit each other and sound like a xylophone.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It chats with others using the sounds of its colliding antennae. These sounds are the hallmarks of fall evenings.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: When the trees take on new hues, more of these Pokémon appear. The tone they create by striking their antennae together resembles that of the marimba, an instrument of foreign lands.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: Its legs are short. Whenever it stumbles, its stiff antennae clack with a xylophone-like sound.
pokedex_entries.Violet: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: There is a village that hosts a contest based on the amazingly variable cries of this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: By allowing its cry to resonate in the hollow of its belly, it produces a captivating sound.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: There is a village that hosts a contest based on the amazingly variable cries of this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It uses its cutlass-like arms to produce sound, the melody of which varies from individual to individual. It is a worthwhile endeavor to seek out one’s favorite tunes.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: By allowing its cry to resonate in the hollow of its belly, it produces a captivating sound.
pokedex_entries.Violet: There is a village that hosts a contest based on the amazingly variable cries of this Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It basically does not fight. With cells similar to those of plants, it can perform photosynthesis.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: When you see LEAFEON asleep in a patch of sunshine, you’ll know it is using photosynthesis to produce clean air.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It basically does not fight. With cells similar to those of plants, it can perform photosynthesis.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: With cells similar to those of plants, it performs photosynthesis inside its body and creates pure air.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When you see Leafeon asleep in a patch of sunshine, you’ll know it is using photosynthesis to produce clean air.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Its cellular composition is closer to that of a plant than an animal. It uses photosynthesis to produce its energy supply without eating food.
pokedex_entries.Moon: The younger they are, the more they smell like fresh grass. With age, their fragrance takes on the odor of fallen leaves.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Although it doesn’t like disputes, it will sharpen the leaf on its tail into a blade and fight if it has to protect its friends.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It gets its nutrition from photosynthesis. It lives a quiet life deep in forests where clean rivers flow.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Galarians favor the distinctive aroma that drifts from this Pokémon’s leaves. There’s a popular perfume made using that scent.
pokedex_entries.Shield: This Pokémon’s tail is blade sharp, with a fantastic cutting edge that can slice right though large trees.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Cells similar to those of plants have been found in its fur. Its hard tail can fell a large tree with one stroke, and the tail’s sharpness exceeds even that of a sword crafted by a master.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: When you see Leafeon asleep in a patch of sunshine, you’ll know it is using photosynthesis to produce clean air.
pokedex_entries.Violet: The younger they are, the more they smell like fresh grass. With age, their fragrance takes on the odor of fallen leaves.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It wraps things with its extensible tongue. Getting too close to it will leave you soaked with drool.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: The long tongue is always soggy with slobber. The saliva contains a solvent that causes numbness.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: Its saliva can decompose anything. It wraps its long tongue around things to coat them with its sticky saliva.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It has space in its throat to store saliva. It can also roll up its tongue and store it in the same spot.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: The long tongue is always soggy with slobber. The saliva contains a solvent that causes numbness.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Their saliva contains lots of components that can dissolve anything. The numbness caused by their lick does not dissipate.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It wraps things with its extensible tongue. Getting too close to it will leave you soaked with drool.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Their saliva contains lots of components that can dissolve anything. The numbness caused by their lick does not dissipate.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: A contest is under way to determine which one can stick its tongue out the farthest. The current record is...more than 82 feet.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It uses its tongue much more skillfully than its hands or its feet. It can deftly pick up a single small bean with its tongue.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Lickilicky’s strange tongue can stretch to many times the length of its body. No one has figured out how Lickilicky’s tongue can stretch so far.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Lickilicky can do just about anything with its tongue, which is as dexterous as the human hand. In contrast, Lickilicky’s use of its fingers is clumsy.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It wraps things with its extensible tongue. Getting too close to it will leave you soaked with drool.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Its tongue can extend and contract freely, and it is capable of reaching lengths over 10 times Lickilicky’s height. Beware of the saliva, as it contains corrosive elements.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: An extremely cautious Pokémon. It cloaks its body with its fluffy ear fur when it senses danger.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It is very conscious of its looks and never fails to groom its ears. It runs with sprightly jumps.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It sheds its fur twice a year. Its winter fur is soft and fluffy.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Extremely cautious, it quickly bounds off when it senses danger.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Extremely cautious, it quickly bounds off when it senses danger.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Lopunny regrows its coat twice a year. Mufflers and hats made from its fur are really warm.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It’s notably wary and has a dislike of fighting, but at the same time, it can deliver powerful kicks with its lithe legs.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Lopunny is constantly monitoring its surroundings. If danger approaches, this Pokémon responds with superdestructive kicks.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Once hot seasons are over, Lopunny’s coat will be replaced with fur that holds a lot of insulating air in preparation for colder weather.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: An extremely cautious Pokémon that cloaks its body with its fluffy ear fur when it senses danger.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It likes to keep itself clean and never fails to groom its ears. It runs with sprightly jumps.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Its fur is warm and yet remarkably light. This Pokémon kicks as though it were a master of karate, driving back its opponents with ease.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It has the ability to sense the auras of all things. It understands human speech.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: By catching the aura emanating from others, it can read their thoughts and movements.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: A well-trained one can sense auras to identify and take in the feelings of creatures over half a mile away.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It’s said that no foe can remain invisible to LUCARIO, since it can detect auras. Even foes it could not otherwise see.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: A well-trained one can sense auras to identify and take in the feelings of creatures over half a mile away.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: By reading the auras of all things, it can tell how others are feeling from over half a mile away.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: By catching the aura emanating from others, it can read their thoughts and movements.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: By reading the auras of all things, it can tell how others are feeling from over half a mile away.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Not only does it perceive auras, but it has also gained the power to control them. It employs them in battle.
pokedex_entries.Moon: They can detect the species of a living being— and its emotions—from over half a mile away. They control auras and hunt their prey in packs.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It concentrates its mental energy and fires off mysterious waves called auras, which can crush boulders of large size to dust.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Lucario reads its opponent’s feelings with its aura waves. It finds out things it would rather not know, so it gets stressed out easily.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It controls waves known as auras, which are powerful enough to pulverize huge rocks. It uses these waves to take down its prey.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It can tell what people are thinking. Only Trainers who have justice in their hearts can earn this Pokémon’s trust.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It has the ability to sense the auras of all things. It understands human speech.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: By sensing the aura emanating from others, it can read their thoughts and movements.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: A most gallant-looking creature. It emits energy waves and controls them with precision, using them to sense even faraway beings. I have given the name “aura” to this power.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: It’s said that no foe can remain invisible to Lucario, since it can detect auras—even those of foes it could not otherwise see.
pokedex_entries.Violet: A well-trained one can use its aura to identify and take in the feelings of creatures over half a mile away.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It lives on the deep-sea floor. It attracts prey by flashing the patterns on its four tail fins.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: To avoid detection by predators, it crawls along the seafloor using the two fins on its chest.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It crawls along the seafloor using its long front fins like legs. It competes for food with LANTURN.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: LUMINEON swimming in the darkness of the deep sea look like stars shining in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It crawls along the seafloor using its long front fins like legs. It competes for food with Lanturn.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It lives on the deep-sea floor. It attracts prey by flashing the patterns on its four tail fins.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: To avoid detection by predators, it crawls along the seafloor using the two fins on its chest.
pokedex_entries.Sun: With its shining light, it lures its prey close. However, the light also happens to attract ferocious fish Pokémon—its natural predators.
pokedex_entries.Moon: This deep-sea Pokémon lives at the bottom of the sea. Its fins haul it over the seabed in search of its favorite food—Starmie.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Deep down at the bottom of the ocean, prey is scarce. Lumineon get into fierce disputes with Lanturn over food.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: They traverse the deep waters as if crawling over the seafloor. The fantastic lights of its fins shine like stars in the night sky.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It lives on the deep-sea floor. It attracts prey by flashing patterns on its four fins.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: To avoid detection by predators, it crawls along the seafloor using the two fins on its chest.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Uses its gleaming fins to hunt its prey. The view of Lumineon schooling near the surface of the sea at night is breathtaking— it’s as though there were shining stars right there.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: With its shining light, it lures its prey close. However, the light also happens to attract ferocious fish Pokémon—its natural predators.
pokedex_entries.Violet: Lumineon swimming in the darkness of the deep sea look like stars shining in the night sky.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It rests its forelegs on others to communicate with rhythmic electric pulses from its claws.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: By gathering their tails together, they collectively generate powerful electricity from their claws.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.
pokedex_entries.Sword: By joining its tail with that of another Luxio, this Pokémon can receive some of the other Luxio’s electricity and power up its own electric blasts.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Upon encountering an opponent, this Pokémon prepares for battle by extending its claws, which can put out 1,000,000 volts of electricity.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause opponents to faint. It lives in small groups.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It rests its forelegs on others to communicate with rhythmic electric pulses from its claws.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Proudly uses its electrified claws as weapons. It seems to be a gracious Pokémon, evenly sharing the spoils of the hunt with others of its kind.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.
pokedex_entries.Violet: By gathering their tails together, they collectively generate powerful electricity from their claws.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It has eyes that can see through anything. It spots and captures prey hiding behind objects.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey--even those taking shelter behind a wall.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: LUXRAY’s ability to see through objects comes in handy when it’s scouting for danger.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.
pokedex_entries.X: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey--even those taking shelter behind a wall.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Luxray’s ability to see through objects comes in handy when it’s scouting for danger.
pokedex_entries.Omega Ruby: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey—even those taking shelter behind a wall.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Luxray can see through solid objects. It will instantly spot prey trying to hide behind walls, even if the walls are thick.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Seeing through solid objects uses up a lot of Luxray’s electricity, so the Pokémon sleeps for long periods of time to store up energy.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It has eyes that can see through anything. It spots and captures prey hiding behind objects.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: When its eyes gleam gold, it can spot hiding prey—even those taking shelter behind a wall.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: They form packs, each having one male as leader. Legends say that when Luxray’s two eyes shimmer with gold, the Pokémon can see through anything.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.
pokedex_entries.Violet: Luxray’s ability to see through objects comes in handy when it’s scouting for danger.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees F from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: When launching 3,600 degrees F fireballs, its body takes on a whitish hue from the intense heat.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. Its breath also sears and sizzles.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: When launching 3,600 degrees F fireballs, its body takes on a whitish hue from the intense heat.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: When shooting 3,600 degree F fireballs from its arms, its body takes on a whitish hue from the intense heat.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. Its breath also sears and sizzles.
pokedex_entries.Sun: They dwell in volcanic craters. According to what is known, a single pair of male and female Magmortar lives in one volcano.
pokedex_entries.Moon: From its arm, it launches fireballs hotter than 3,500 degrees Fahrenheit. Its arm starts to melt when it fires a whole barrage.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: There are still quite a few factories that rely on the flames provided by Magmortar to process metals.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Magmortar takes down its enemies by shooting fireballs, which burn them to a blackened crisp. It avoids this method when hunting prey.
pokedex_entries.Sword: When Magmortar inhales deeply, the fire burning in its belly intensifies, rising in temperature to over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Living in the crater of a volcano has caused this Pokémon’s body to resemble its environment—it has an organ similar to a magma chamber.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Use of a strange item caused this Pokémon to evolve. Fireballs launched from the ends of its tubelike arms are hot enough to melt an iron pot in an instant.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: A group tried to use scientific means to make MAGNEZONE evolve, but their efforts ended in failure.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Exposure to a special magnetic field changed MAGNETON’s molecular structure, turning it into MAGNEZONE.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: A group tried to use scientific means to make Magnezone evolve, but their efforts ended in failure.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Sometimes the magnetism emitted by Magnezone is too strong, making them attract each other so they cannot move.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Sometimes the magnetism emitted by Magnezone is too strong, making them attract each other so they cannot move.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Three units generate magnetism. There have been many mistaken reports of UFO sightings when Magnezone flies through the night sky.
pokedex_entries.Moon: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin, while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It uses radar to monitor its territory. Intruders are quickly disposed of with a hyper beam.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: There are still people who believe that this Pokémon came from outer space. It emanates a powerful magnetic field.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Some say that Magnezone receives signals from space via the antenna on its head and that it’s being controlled by some mysterious being.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It’s thought that a special magnetic field changed the molecular structure of this Pokémon’s body, and that’s what caused the Pokémon’s evolution.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Its three units generate magnetism.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: I theorize that a special magnetic field influenced this Pokémon, changing its molecular structure and causing it to evolve. It emits strange radio waves toward space from its antenna.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.
pokedex_entries.Violet: Exposure to a special magnetic field changed Magneton’s molecular structure, turning it into Magnezone.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: A frozen one was dug up from soil dating back 10,000 years. It woke up to much amazement.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: A frozen MAMOSWINE was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokémon has been around a long, long, long time.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: It flourished worldwide during the ice age but its population declined when the masses of ice began to dwindle.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: A frozen one was dug up from soil dating back 10,000 years. It woke up to much amazement.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: When the temperature rose at the end of the ice age, most Mamoswine disappeared.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: A frozen Mamoswine was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokémon has been around a long, long, long time.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon can be spotted in wall paintings from as far back as 10,000 years ago. For a while, it was thought to have gone extinct.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It looks strong, and that’s exactly what it is. As the weather grows colder, its ice tusks grow longer, thicker, and more impressive.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The ice age is over and the climate has warmed, so this Pokémon’s population has thinned.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This species reached its zenith during the period known as the ice age. I suspect that Hisui’s frigid climate is in harmony with Mamoswine’s constitution, thus awakening hidden potential.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Born on a cold seafloor, it will swim great distances to return to its birthplace.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Water makes up 80% of its body. This Pokémon is easily affected by its environment.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Born on a cold seafloor, it will swim great distances to return to its birthplace.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Water makes up 80 percent of its body. This Pokémon is easily affected by its environment.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Rumored to migrate across the oceans and visit Hisui’s coastal waters only rarely. Although Manaphy resembles Phione, it is also quite different. The relation between the two is unclear.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: A friendly Pokémon that captures the subtle flows of seawater using its two antennae.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Scientists discovered that the distinctive patterns on its back differ by region.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: People organize tours to see this Pokémon frolic and skim the tops of waves with REMORAID.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: When it swims close to the surface of the ocean, people aboard ships are able to observe the pattern on its back.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: People organize tours to see this Pokémon frolic and skim the tops of waves with Remoraid.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The pattern on its back varies by region. It often swims in a school of Remoraid.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The pattern on its back varies by region. It often swims in a school of Remoraid.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When it swims close to the surface of the ocean, people aboard ships are able to observe the pattern on its back.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It’s highly friendly and easily tamed. Tours that take people swimming with Mantyke are a super-popular beach activity.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Mantyke are friendly toward people and will approach boats closely. The patterns on their backs differ depending on their habitat.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Mantyke living in Galar seem to be somewhat sluggish. The colder waters of the seas in this region may be the cause.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It swims along with a school of Remoraid, and they’ll all fight together to repel attackers.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: A friendly Pokémon that senses the subtle flows of seawater using its two antennae.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Scientists discovered that the distinctive patterns on its back differ by region.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Though ball-like in shape, this Pokémon is a proficient swimmer. I have discovered that if a Mantyke spends much time with schools of Remoraid, it will eventually achieve evolution.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake’s surface.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: When MESPRIT flew, people learned the joy and sadness of living. It was the birth of emotions.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: This Pokémon is said to have endowed the human heart with emotions, such as sorrow and joy.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: When Mesprit flew, people learned the joy and sadness of living. It was the birth of emotions.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake’s surface.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It is known as the Being of Emotion. It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake’s surface.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Known as the Being of Emotion. In legend, this Pokémon was feared, as any who showed disrespect would have their emotions thrown into disarray.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It likes places where people gather. It mimics foes to confuse them, then makes its getaway.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It mimics the expressions and motions of those it sees to understand the feelings of others.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: In an attempt to confuse its enemy, it mimics the enemy’s movements. Then it wastes no time in making itself scarce!
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It mimics the expressions and motions of those it sees to understand the feelings of others.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: In an attempt to confuse its enemy, it mimics the enemy’s movements. Then it wastes no time in making itself scarce!
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It does its absolute best to mimic the movements and expressions of its opponents, but it’s still not very good at it.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: When this gifted mimic surprises an opponent, Mime Jr. feels so happy that it ends up forgetting it was imitating something.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It mimics everyone it sees, but it puts extra effort into copying the graceful dance steps of Mr. Rime as practice.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It looks for a Mr. Rime that’s a good dancer and carefully copies the Mr. Rime’s steps like an apprentice.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It habitually mimics foes. The mimicked foe is said to be unable to look away from Mime Jr.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It likes places where people gather. It mimics foes to confuse them, then makes its getaway.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Known to turn up in bustling marketplaces now and again. It mimics people much as a child would, then watches how they react, eyes sparkling.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Its cries sound like incantations. Those hearing it are tormented by headaches and hallucinations.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It chants incantations. While they usually torment targets, some chants bring happiness.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its cry sounds like an incantation. It is said the cry may rarely be imbued with happiness-giving power.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its cries sound like incantations to torment the foe. It appears where you least expect it.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its cry sounds like an incantation. It is said the cry may rarely be imbued with happiness-giving power.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It chants incantations. While they usually torment targets, some chants bring happiness.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its cries sound like incantations to torment the foe. It appears where you least expect it.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It appears as if from nowhere—muttering incantations, placing curses, and giving people terrifying visions.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Mismagius have been known to cast spells to make people fall in love, so some people search for this Pokémon as if their life depended on it.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Feared for its wrath and the curses it spreads, this Pokémon will also, on a whim, cast spells that help people.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Its muttered curses can cause awful headaches or terrifying visions that torment others.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Its cries sound like incantations. Those who hear it are tormented by headaches and hallucinations.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It chants incantations. While these incantations can torment targets, some bring happiness.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: The incantations Mismagius chants can ward against misfortune, so a custom exists of inviting it into one’s home. Incur the Pokémon’s displeasure, however, and disaster will surely ensue.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: Its cry sounds like an incantation. It is said the cry may rarely be imbued with happiness-giving power.
pokedex_entries.Violet: Its cries sound like incantations to torment the foe. It appears where you least expect it.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: To intimidate attackers, it stretches the fire on its tail to make itself appear bigger.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It skillfully controls the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: A bigger fire on its tail and a brighter blue pattern on its face means its rank in its pack is higher.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It skillfully controls the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It skillfully controls the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: To intimidate attackers, it expands the fire on its tail to make itself appear bigger.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one of its weapons.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: The deeper the blue on its face, the more powerful it will grow to become. It leaps about every which way and lands powerful blows against its opponents with the flame on its tail.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by COMBEE.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It does not keep a nest. It flies over fields and mountains in constant search of floral honey.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: While it loves floral honey, it won’t gather any itself. Instead, it plots to steal some from COMBEE.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It flutters around at night and steals honey from the COMBEE hive.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: While it loves floral honey, it won’t gather any itself. Instead, it plots to steal some from Combee.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by Combee.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It flutters around at night and steals honey from the Combee hive.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It loves the nectar of flowers and steals nectar collected by Combee.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It does not keep a nest. It flies over fields and mountains in constant search of its much-beloved nectar.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Scatters steel-colored scales as it flaps its wings. Despite being observed feeding primarily on the nectar of flowers, Mothim is not often seen around flower gardens.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It wolfs down its weight in food once a day, swallowing food whole with almost no chewing.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It hides food under its long body hair. However, it forgets it has hidden the food.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: In its desperation to gulp down food, it forgets about the food it has hidden under its fur.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It conceals food under the long fur on its body. It carts around this food stash and swallows it without chewing.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: In its desperation to gulp down food, it forgets about the food it has hidden under its fur.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It hides food under its long body hair. However, it forgets it has hidden the food.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It conceals food under the long fur on its body. It carts around this food stash and swallows it without chewing.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It needs to consume its own weight in food every day. As far as flavor is concerned, it’s indifferent.
pokedex_entries.Moon: When it finds something that looks like it might be edible, it goes right ahead and swallows it whole. That’s why it gets fatter day by day.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It hides food under its long fur, but it sometimes forgets about it and causes a stinky disturbance.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Anything that looks edible, Munchlax will go on and swallow whole. Its stomach is tough enough to handle it even if the food has gone rotten.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Stuffing itself with vast amounts of food is its only concern. Whether the food is rotten or fresh, yummy or tasteless—it does not care.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It stores food beneath its fur. It might share just one bite, but only if it really trusts you.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It wolfs down its weight in food once a day, swallowing it whole with almost no chewing.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It hides food under its long body hair. However, it forgets it has hidden the food.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Its robust stomach allows it to nonchalantly devour even rotted matter. It pays frequent visits to villages, seeking out food scraps intended for compost.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It makes electricity with pouches in its cheeks and shoots charges from its tail. It lives atop trees.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It’s one of the kinds of Pokémon with electric cheek pouches. It shoots charges from its tail.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It stores its own fur balls that crackle with static electricity together with its favorite berries in tree hollows.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It makes electricity with pouches in its cheeks and shoots charges from its tail. It lives atop trees.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: A species related to the Pikachu line. Though Pachirisu is a calm Pokémon, it still presents a danger should one touch its electrified tail or cheeks.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: It’s one of the kinds of Pokémon with electric cheek pouches. It shoots charges from its tail.
pokedex_entries.Violet: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It is said to live in a gap in the spatial dimension parallel to ours. It appears in mythology.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: A legendary Pokémon of Sinnoh. It is said that space becomes more stable with PALKIA’s every breath.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its total control over the boundaries of space enable it to transport itself to faraway places or even other dimensions.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: A legendary Pokémon of Sinnoh. It is said that space becomes more stable with Palkia’s every breath.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It is said to live in a gap in the spatial dimension parallel to ours. It appears in mythology.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It is said to live in a gap in the spatial dimension parallel to ours. Palkia appears in mythology.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This Pokémon is feared as a deity in Hisuian legend. The birth of Palkia was what caused the walls of our world to disappear, creating a sky that spans for infinity.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: A Pokémon that lives in warm seas. It inflates the flotation sac on its head to drift and search for food.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: When the water warms, they inflate the flotation sac on their heads and drift languidly on the sea in packs.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: A Pokémon that lives in warm seas. It inflates the flotation sac on its head to drift and search for food.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Can be seen floating offshore during seasons when the seas are warm. Its azure body blends in with the ocean waters—logic suggests this is a defense mechanism against natural predators.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It lives along shores in northern countries. A skilled swimmer, it dives for over 10 minutes to hunt.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It doesn’t like to be taken care of. It’s difficult to bond with since it won’t listen to its Trainer.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It doesn’t like to be taken care of. It’s difficult to bond with since it won’t listen to its Trainer.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It lives along the shore in northern countries. A skilled swimmer, it dives for over 10 minutes while hunting.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Prefers cold climes and appears along coasts. It’s an adorable little thing—as cute as any child—but it’s also prideful, unwilling to accept handouts from people.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its programming was modified to enable work in alien dimensions. It did not work as planned.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its programming was modified to enable it to travel through alien dimensions. Seems there might have been an error...
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its programming was modified to enable work in alien dimensions. It did not work as planned.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its programming was modified to enable it to travel through alien dimensions. Seems there might have been an error...
pokedex_entries.Sun: In order to create a more advanced Pokémon, an additional program was installed, but apparently it contained a defect that makes it move oddly.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Its program was modified to facilitate extra-dimensional activities, but that led to noticeably strange behavior.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Its behavior is noticeably unstable, which is apparently due to the incompetence of the engineer who updated its programming.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: A faulty update was added to its programming. Its behavior is noticeably strange, so the experiment may have been a failure.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Porygon-Z had a program installed to allow it to move between dimensions, but the program also caused instability in Porygon-Z’s behavior.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Some say an additional program made this Pokémon evolve, but even academics can’t agree on whether Porygon-Z is really an evolution.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Additional software was installed to make it an even better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: A curious item induced this evolution. The Pokémon’s offensive capabilities have greatly increased, but the strangeness of its behavior has magnified in equal measure. This worries me.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Its wings deliver wicked blows that snap even the thickest of trees. It searches for prey in icy seas.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Because every PRINPLUP considers itself to be the most important, they can never form a group.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Because every Prinplup considers itself to be the most important, they can never form a group.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Its wings deliver wicked blows that snap even the thickest of trees. It searches for prey in icy seas.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It swims gracefully through the frigid sea and sings with a voice like the roaring tide. It has powerful, sturdy wings and dignity to match.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It exudes strong magnetism from all over. It controls three small units called Mini-Noses.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It controls three units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force. With them, it can attack the foe from three directions.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It freely controls three units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It exudes strong magnetism from all over. It controls three small units called Mini-Noses.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It radiates such a powerful magnetic field that nearby electrical appliances become unusable.
pokedex_entries.Moon: The main body controls three mobile units called Mini-Noses, which it maneuvers to catch prey.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: Although it can control its units known as Mini-Noses, they sometimes get lost and don’t come back.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It uses three small units to catch prey and battle enemies. The main body mostly just gives orders.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its entire body exudes strong magnetism. Probopass controls three small units called Mini-Noses.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It is able to emit powerful magnetism, allowing it control over the iron sand that forms its luscious mustache. Using this iron sand, Probopass forms hard stones with which it smites its prey.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It is a brazen brute that barges its way into another Pokémon’s nest and claims it as its own.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It binds its body with its tails to make itself look bigger. If it locks eyes, it will glare ceaselessly.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It would claim another Pokémon’s nest as its own if it finds a nest sufficiently comfortable.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It binds its body with its tails to make itself look bigger. If it locks eyes, it will glare ceaselessly.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It would claim another Pokémon’s nest as its own if it finds a nest sufficiently comfortable.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It is a brazen brute that barges its way into another Pokémon’s nest and claims it as its own.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its split tail.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Though impudent and difficult to tame, Purugly enjoys great popularity due to its fur, the beauty of which surpasses even velveteen.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Its powerful head butt has enough power to shatter even the most durable things upon impact.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Its skull is as hard as iron. It is a brute that tears down jungle trees while catching prey.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: If two were to smash their heads together, their foot-thick skulls would keep them from fainting.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its skull withstands impacts of any magnitude. As a result, its brain never gets the chance to grow.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: If two were to smash their heads together, their foot-thick skulls would keep them from fainting.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its skull withstands impacts of any magnitude. As a result, its brain never gets the chance to grow.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its skull is as hard as iron. It is a brute that tears down jungle trees while catching prey.
pokedex_entries.Sun: The result of repeated headbutts is a skull grown thick and hard. However, its brain has shrunk in size compared with Cranidos’s.
pokedex_entries.Moon: Records exist of a revived fossil that evolved into Rampardos. It proceeded to escape and then destroy a skyscraper with a headbutt.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: In ancient times, people would dig up fossils of this Pokémon and use its skull, which is harder than steel, to make helmets.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: This ancient Pokémon used headbutts skillfully. Its brain was really small, so some theories suggest that its stupidity led to its extinction.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Its powerful headbutt has enough force to shatter even the most durable things upon impact.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Its skull is as hard as iron. It is a brute that tears down jungle trees while catching prey.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Very little is known about its biology. Can knock down massive trees by smashing its beautiful, pearl-like crown against them.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It is believed to have shaped REGIROCK, REGICE, and REGISTEEL out of clay, ice, and magma.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It is said to have made Pokémon that look like itself from a special ice mountain, rocks, and magma.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.
pokedex_entries.Sword: All over the world, there are legends that tell of Regigigas creating other Pokémon in its own image.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It’s said that Regigigas created other Pokémon from many different materials before it moved the continents to where they are today.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: According to legend, Regigigas pulled landmasses together and bound them with rope to create the continent of Hisui. Though I have my doubts, the story could well contain a shred of truth.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. GEODUDE are shot at rare times.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It can launch a rock held in its hand like a missile by tightening then expanding muscles instantly.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: From holes in its palms, it fires out GEODUDE. Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It can launch a rock held in its hand like a missile by tightening then expanding muscles instantly.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: From holes in its palms, it fires out Geodude. Its carapace can withstand volcanic eruptions.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It can load up to three projectiles per arm into the holes in its hands. What launches out of those holes could be either rocks or Roggenrola.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It relies on its carapace to deflect incoming attacks and throw its enemy off balance. As soon as that happens, it drives its drill into the foe.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. On rare occasions, the Pokémon even shoots out Geodude.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This Pokémon evolved through use of a curious item. Its rocklike hide is composed of a mysterious substance and can withstand a blow from a masterwork sword with nary a scratch.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Its body is lithe yet powerful. It can crest three mountains and cross two canyons in one night.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It has the peculiar power of being able to see emotions such as joy and rage in the form of waves.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: They communicate with one another using their auras. They are able to run all through the night.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It has the peculiar power of being able to see emotions such as joy and rage in the form of waves.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It uses the shapes of auras, which change according to emotion, to communicate with others.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It uses the shapes of auras, which change according to emotion, to communicate with others.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.
pokedex_entries.Sun: It can discern the physical and emotional states of people, Pokémon, and other natural things from the shape of their aura waves.
pokedex_entries.Moon: It’s tough enough to run right through the night, and it’s also a hard worker, but it’s still just a youngster.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: It knows how people and Pokémon feel by looking at their auras. It doesn’t approach dangerous opponents.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: It uses waves called auras to communicate with others of its kind. It doesn’t make any noise during this time, so its enemies can’t detect it.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It’s exceedingly energetic, with enough stamina to keep running all through the night. Taking it for walks can be a challenging experience.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It can use waves called auras to gauge how others are feeling. These same waves can also tell this Pokémon about the state of the environment.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Its body is lithe yet powerful. It can crest three mountains and cross two canyons in one night.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Though infantile in appearance, it has the mysterious ability to read the minds of humans. The pure of heart are met with Riolu’s approval, while those of ill nature earn only its loathing.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: They communicate with one another using their auras. They are able to run all through the night.
pokedex_entries.Violet: It has the peculiar power of being able to see emotions, such as joy and rage, in the form of waves.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It attracts prey with a sweet aroma, then downs it with thorny whips hidden in its arms.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: With the movements of a dancer, it strikes with whips that are densely lined with poison thorns.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Each of its hands contains different toxins, but both hands can jab with near-fatal power.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its sweet aroma attracts prey. Then it spews poison. The more toxic it is, the sweeter its aroma.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Each of its hands contains different toxins, but both hands can jab with near-fatal power.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Luring prey with a sweet scent, it uses poison whips on its arms to poison, bind, and finish off the prey.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Luring prey with a sweet scent, it uses poison whips on its arms to poison, bind, and finish off the prey.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: With the movements of a dancer, it strikes with whips that are densely lined with poison thorns.
pokedex_entries.Sword: After captivating opponents with its sweet scent, it lashes them with its thorny whips.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The poison in its right hand is quick acting. The poison in its left hand is slow acting. Both are life threatening.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It attracts prey with a sweet aroma, then downs it with thorny whips hidden in its arms.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: With the movements of a dancer, it strikes with whips that are densely lined with poison thorns.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Hidden within the bouquet on each hand are thorned whips loaded with virulent poison. Roserade moves gracefully as it corners its prey and mercilessly lashes them with its whips.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its electric-like body can enter some kinds of machines and take control in order to make mischief.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Research continues on this Pokémon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its electric-like body can enter some kinds of machines and take control in order to make mischief.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Research continues on this Pokémon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.
pokedex_entries.Sword: One boy’s invention led to the development of many different machines that take advantage of Rotom’s unique capabilities.
pokedex_entries.Shield: With a body made of plasma, it can inhabit all sorts of machines. It loves to surprise others.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This bizarre Pokémon appears to be a will-o’-the-wisp powered by electricity. Be wary, as Rotom is both smart and mischievous.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: Its electricity-like body can enter some kinds of machines and take control in order to make mischief.
pokedex_entries.Violet: Research continues on this Pokémon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It lives in flower patches and avoids detection by curling up to look like a flowering plant.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It can dissolve toxins in the air to instantly transform ruined land into a lush field of flowers.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: The flowers all over its body burst into bloom if it is lovingly hugged and senses gratitude.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: The flowers all over its body burst into bloom if it is lovingly hugged and senses gratitude.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It can dissolve toxins in the air to instantly transform ruined land into a lush field of flowers.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It lives in common flower patches but is rarely noticed. It is often mistaken for a flowering plant when curled up.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It can dissolve toxins in the air to instantly transform ruined land into a lush field of flowers.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: When the turning of seasons brings the cruel winter to its end and the joyous people give thanks to the heavens, Shaymin appears and covers the withered land with flowers.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Its colors and shapes differ from region to region. In the Sinnoh region, two types are confirmed.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It lives along bodies of water. Its body shape has changed to suit its habitat.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Its shape and coloration vary, depending on its habitat.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Beware of pushing strongly on its squishy body, as it makes a mysterious purple fluid ooze out.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its shape and coloration vary, depending on its habitat.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Its colors and shapes differ from region to region. In the Sinnoh region, two types are confirmed.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It lives along bodies of water. Its body shape changed to suit its habitat.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Found in abundance on seashores bordering warm waters. Shellos are unexpectedly friendly and will crawl toward any person they see. Take care not to get coated in mucus!

pokedex_entries.Diamond: A Pokémon that lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its facial hide is extremely hard.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It habitually polishes its face by rubbing it against tree trunks. It is weak to attacks from behind.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It is outstandingly armored. As a result, it can eat grass and berries without having to fight.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It was generated from a fossil dug out of a layer of clay that was older than anyone knows. It has a sturdy face.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It is outstandingly armored. As a result, it can eat grass and berries without having to fight.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It habitually polishes its face by rubbing it against tree trunks. It is weak to attacks from behind.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It was generated from a fossil dug out of a layer of clay that was older than anyone knows. It has a sturdy face.
pokedex_entries.Sun: Many fossils of this Pokémon have been found, but almost none have shown signs of damage to the face.
pokedex_entries.Moon: This Pokémon lived in primeval jungles. Few enemies would have been willing to square off against its heavily armored face, so it’s thought.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: A mild-mannered, herbivorous Pokémon, it used its face to dig up tree roots to eat. The skin on its face was plenty tough.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Although its fossils can be found in layers of primeval rock, nothing but its face has ever been discovered.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: A Pokémon that lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its facial hide is extremely hard.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It habitually polishes its face by rubbing it against tree trunks. It is weak to attacks from behind.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Much remains unknown about this Pokémon, as few have ever seen it. However, we know that it is calm and dislikes conflict, and it enjoys polishing its face against trees and rocks.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Its forelegs have a muscle-based system of generating electricity. Its body shines if endangered.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. Its fur glows when it’s in trouble.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.
pokedex_entries.Sword: This Pokémon generates electricity by contracting its muscles. Excited trembling is a sign that Shinx is generating a tremendous amount of electricity.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Electricity makes this Pokémon’s fur glow. Shinx sends signals to others of its kind by shaking the tip of its tail while the tail tip is shining brightly.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Its forelegs have a muscle-based system of generating electricity. Its body shines when it is in danger.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Shakes its body to generate electricity. Its stature belies its aggression—one must be patient to tame this Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
pokedex_entries.Violet: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. Its fur glows when it’s in trouble.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It lives in arid lands. It buries itself in sand and lies in wait for unsuspecting prey.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: As soon as the tail claws close, its needle tips secrete poison. It can survive a year without food.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: As soon as the tail claws close, its needle tips secrete poison. It can survive a year without food.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It lives in arid regions and can go without food for a year while waiting for prey.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.
pokedex_entries.Sword: After burrowing into the sand, it waits patiently for prey to come near. This Pokémon and Sizzlipede share common descent.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It attacks using the claws on its tail. Once locked in its grip, its prey is unable to move as this Pokémon’s poison seeps in.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It lives in arid lands. It buries itself in sand and lies in wait for unsuspecting prey.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Its claws are not only razor-sharp but poisonous, making Skorupi a highly dangerous Pokémon. It seems to be weakened by cold temperatures, however.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. Its range is over 160 feet.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It sprays a stinky fluid from its tail. The fluid smells worse the longer it is allowed to fester.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It attacks by spraying a horribly smelly fluid from the tip of its tail. Attacks from above confound it.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It attacks by spraying a repugnant fluid from its tail, but the stench dulls after a few squirts.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It attacks by spraying a horribly smelly fluid from the tip of its tail. Attacks from above confound it.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. Its range is over 160 feet.
