pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It sprays a stinky fluid from its tail. The fluid smells worse the longer it is allowed to fester.
pokedex_entries.Sword: In its belly, it reserves stinky fluid that it shoots from its tail during battle. As this Pokémon’s diet varies, so does the stench of its fluid.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It digs holes in the ground to make its nest. The stench of the fluid it lets fly from the tip of its tail is extremely potent.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. It can fire this spray more than 160 feet.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It sprays a stinky fluid from its tail. The fluid smells worse the longer it is allowed to fester in its belly.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Sprays a poisonous fluid to take down prey. Sometimes, unable to stomach the stench of its own fluid, it leaves the bested prey uneaten.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: It attacks by spraying a horribly smelly fluid from the tip of its tail. Attacks from above confound it.
pokedex_entries.Violet: It attacks by spraying a repugnant fluid from its tail, but the stench dulls after a few squirts.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It lives on snowy mountains. Having had little contact with humans, it is boldly inquisitive.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Seemingly curious about people, they gather around footsteps they find on snowy mountains.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain’s lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Seemingly curious about people, they gather around footsteps they find on snowy mountains.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain’s lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It lives on snowy mountains. It sinks its legs into the snow to absorb water and keep its own temperature down.
pokedex_entries.Shield: The berries that grow around its belly are like ice pops. Galarian Darumaka absolutely love these berries.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It lives on snowy mountains. Having had little contact with humans, it is boldly inquisitive.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: One is likely to encounter this Pokémon while out in the snow. There are stories of Snover appearing in human settlements but doing no harm—rather, they bond with the children.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain’s lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.
pokedex_entries.Violet: Seemingly curious about people, they gather around footsteps they find on snowy mountains.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: A Pokémon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It was bound to a fissure in an odd keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its constant mischief and misdeeds resulted in it being bound to an Odd Keystone by a mysterious spell.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It was formed by uniting 108 spirits. It has been bound to the Odd Keystone to keep it from doing any mischief.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Its constant mischief and misdeeds resulted in it being bound to an Odd Keystone by a mysterious spell.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: A Pokémon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It was bound to a fissure in an odd keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Exactly 108 spirits gathered to become this Pokémon. Apparently there are some ill-natured spirits in the mix.
pokedex_entries.Shield: All Spiritomb’s mischief and misdeeds compelled a traveler to use a mysterious spell to bind Spiritomb to an odd keystone.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It is a Pokémon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It was bound to a fissure in an odd keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It lays curses by thinking wicked thoughts. Writings tell that this Pokémon was born out of the assembly of five score and eight malevolent spirits.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: Its constant mischief and misdeeds resulted in it being bound to an Odd Keystone by a mysterious spell.
pokedex_entries.Violet: It was formed by uniting 108 spirits. It has been bound to the Odd Keystone to keep it from doing any mischief.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It has a savage nature. It will courageously challenge foes that are much larger.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: The muscles in its wings and legs are strong. It can easily fly while gripping a small Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It never stops attacking even if it is injured. It fusses over the shape of its comb.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: When STARAVIA evolve into STARAPTOR, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It never stops attacking even if it is injured. It fusses over the shape of its comb.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: The muscles in its wings and legs are strong. It can easily fly while gripping a small Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It has a savage nature. It will courageously challenge foes that are much larger than itself.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: The muscles in its wings and legs are strong. It can easily fly while gripping a small Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: It has left the flock, having gained strength enough to survive on its own. The astounding force with which Staraptor flies through the air allows it to carry away large, burly targets.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.
pokedex_entries.Violet: It never stops attacking even if it is injured. It fusses over the shape of its comb.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It flies around forests and fields in search of bug Pokémon. It stays within a huge flock.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Recognizing their own weakness, they always live in a group. When alone, a STARAVIA cries noisily.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: They maintain huge flocks, although fierce scuffles break out between various flocks.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Recognizing their own weakness, they always live in a group. When alone, a Staravia cries noisily.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They maintain huge flocks, although fierce scuffles break out between various flocks.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: They fly around forests and fields in search of bug Pokémon, moving together in huge flocks.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: They live in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: They form remarkably large flocks and are constantly fighting amongst themselves. I suspect that those with magnificent plumes on their heads are the strong ones.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: Recognizing their own weakness, they always live in a group. When alone, a Staravia cries noisily.
pokedex_entries.Violet: They maintain huge flocks, although fierce scuffles break out between various flocks.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Usually with a large flock, it is barely noticeable when alone. Its cries are very strident.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Because they are weak individually, they form groups. However, they bicker if the group grows too big.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Because they are weak individually, they form groups. However, they bicker if the group grows too big.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Usually with a large flock, it is barely noticeable when alone. Its cries are very strident.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: They live in the fields and mountains, gathering in large flocks. Their cries are quite obnoxious. Though small, their wings are strong—a strike from them leaves pain that persists for a week.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.
pokedex_entries.Violet: Because they are weak individually, they form groups. However, they bicker if the group grows too big.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It sprays a nose-curling, stinky fluid from its rear to repel attackers.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: The foul fluid from its rear is so revolting that it can make people feel queasy up to a mile and a quarter away.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.
pokedex_entries.Sword: From its rear, it sprays a foul-smelling liquid at opponents. It aims for their faces, and it can hit them from over 16 feet away.
pokedex_entries.Shield: If it lifts its tail and points its rear at you, beware. It’s about to spray you with a fluid stinky enough to make you faint.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It sprays a nose-curling, stinky fluid from its rear to repel attackers.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: The poison that gushes from its aft end is accompanied by an utterly evil-smelling odor with such potency that one whiff can induce memory loss.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.
pokedex_entries.Violet: The foul fluid from its rear is so revolting that it can make people feel queasy up to a mile and a quarter away.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its arms are made of plants that bind themselves to things. They grow back right away if cut.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: When it remains still, it appears to be a large shrub. Unsuspecting prey that wander near get ensnared by its vines.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can’t even see its eyes.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Its arms are made of plants that bind themselves to things. They grow back right away if cut.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: Even if one of its arms is eaten, it’s fine. The Pokémon regenerates quickly and will go right back to normal.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can’t even see its eyes.
pokedex_entries.Sword: Tangrowth has two arms that it can extend as it pleases. Recent research has shown that these arms are, in fact, bundles of vines.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Vine growth is accelerated for Tangrowth living in warm climates. If the vines grow long, Tangrowth shortens them by tearing parts of them off.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Draped with long vines, it resembles a shrub in appearance. It swings bundles of vines as though they were arms, wrapping them around prey to ensnare them.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: It will never appear where there is strife. Its sightings have become rare recently.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another’s rights and avoid needless strife.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: As everyone knows, it visits peaceful regions, bringing them gifts of kindness and sweet blessings.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another’s rights and avoid needless strife.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: As everyone knows, it visits peaceful regions, bringing them gifts of kindness and sweet blessings.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another’s rights and avoid needless strife.
pokedex_entries.Sword: These Pokémon are never seen anywhere near conflict or turmoil. In recent times, they’ve hardly been seen at all.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Known as a bringer of blessings, it’s been depicted on good-luck charms since ancient times.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: It will never appear where there is strife. Sightings of this Pokémon have recently become rare.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Scant few have ever sighted this Pokémon. After studying what literature remains, I am certain Togekiss will reveal itself when peace reigns in the land.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Groups of this Pokémon migrating in search of water have been mistaken for “moving forests.”
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Some Pokémon are born on a TORTERRA’s back and spend their entire life there.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Ancient people imagined that beneath the ground, a gigantic TORTERRA dwelled.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: Some Pokémon are born on a Torterra’s back and spend their entire life there.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Ancient people imagined that beneath the ground, a gigantic Torterra dwelled.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Groups of this Pokémon migrating in search of water have been mistaken for moving forests.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This remarkable, large-bodied Pokémon would serve beautifully as borrowed scenery for a garden, and its strength is peerless. Torterra roams the wilderness in search of clean water.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: The toxin made in its poison sacs is pumped to the knuckle claws through tubes down its arms.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Swaying and dodging the attacks of its foes, it weaves its flexible body in close, then lunges out with its poisonous claws.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: The croaking that Toxicroak produces before a battle is for churning the poison it has stored in its poison sac.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It bounces toward opponents and gouges them with poisonous claws. No more than a scratch is needed to knock out its adversaries.
pokedex_entries.Shield: It booms out a victory croak when its prey goes down in defeat. This Pokémon and Seismitoad are related species.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: The toxin made in its poison sac is pumped to the knuckle claws through tubes down its arms.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Its crimson claws contain a virulent toxin. This toxin can be made into a tonic by diluting it, mixing it with several types of wild grass, and boiling it down over two days.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: Swaying and dodging the attacks of its foes, it weaves its flexible body in close, then lunges out with its poisonous claws.
pokedex_entries.Violet: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Made from soil, the shell on its back hardens when it drinks water. It lives along lakes.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: The shell on its back is made of soil. On a very healthy TURTWIG, the shell should feel moist.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: Photosynthesis occurs across its body under the sun. The shell on its back is actually hardened soil.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: The shell on its back is made of soil. On a very healthy Turtwig, the shell should feel moist.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Photosynthesis occurs across its body under the sun. The shell on its back is actually hardened soil.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Made from soil, the shell on its back hardens when it drinks water. It lives along lakes.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It undertakes photosynthesis within its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if the Pokémon is thirsty.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This Pokémon becomes more energetic the more sunlight there is. The part resembling a shell is similar to silt and is slightly damp and warm to the touch.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Known as “The Being of Knowledge.” It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: When UXIE flew, people gained the ability to solve problems. It was the birth of knowledge.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: According to some sources, this Pokémon provided people with the intelligence necessary to solve various problems.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: When Uxie flew, people gained the ability to solve problems. It was the birth of knowledge.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Known as “The Being of Knowledge.” It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Known as the Being of Knowledge, it is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: A Pokémon feared but also respected for stealing away the memories of evildoers. I have found records that suggest Uxie holds dominion over knowledge.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by COMBEE.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: When endangered, grubs from its six-cell honeycomb strike back. There is only one in a colony.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: It releases various pheromones to make the grubs in its body do its bidding while fighting foes.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It raises grubs in the holes in its body. It secretes pheromones to control COMBEE.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: It releases various pheromones to make the grubs in its body do its bidding while fighting foes.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It houses its colony in cells in its body and releases various pheromones to make those grubs do its bidding.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It houses its colony in cells in its body and releases various pheromones to make those grubs do its bidding.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by Combee.
pokedex_entries.Sword: It skillfully commands its grubs in battles with its enemies. The grubs are willing to risk their lives to defend Vespiquen.
pokedex_entries.Shield: Vespiquen that give off more pheromones have larger swarms of Combee attendants.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on nectar collected by Combee.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: When it is in danger, grubs from its six-cell honeycomb strike back. There is only one in a colony.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Commands its subjects to build its hive. It will dispatch any interlopers who dare sneak into its nest and use them as nourishment for itself.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: It houses its colony in cells in its body and releases various pheromones to make those grubs do its bidding.
pokedex_entries.Violet: It raises grubs in the holes in its body. It secretes pheromones to control Combee.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: It sends signals to others by carving odd patterns in frost-covered trees and ice.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: They communicate by clawing signs in boulders and work together to surround enemies.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.
pokedex_entries.Sun: They travel in groups of four or five, leaving signs for one another on trees and rocks. They bring down their prey with coordinated attacks.
pokedex_entries.Moon: They dwell in cold places. This Pokémon’s main food source in Alola is Vulpix and Sandshrew, which they carefully divide among their group.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Sun: One Weavile will trip a Sandshrew and flip it over, and then another Weavile will deal the finishing blow with its sharp claws.
pokedex_entries.Ultra Moon: Thanks to its increased intelligence, scrapping over food is a thing of the past. A scratch from its claws will give you a case of frostbite!
pokedex_entries.Sword: They attack their quarry in packs. Prey as large as Mamoswine easily fall to the teamwork of a group of Weavile.
pokedex_entries.Shield: With its claws, it leaves behind signs for its friends to find. The number of distinct signs is said to be over 500.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: It sends signals to others of its kind by carving odd patterns on trees and ice.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: This species corners prey as a pack, under the guidance of a leader. Weavile displays increased cunning, leading me to speculate that its evolution caused further brain development.
pokedex_entries.Scarlet: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.
pokedex_entries.Violet: They travel in groups of four or five, leaving signs for one another on trees and rocks. They bring down their prey with coordinated attacks.

pokedex_entries.Diamond: When BURMY evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.
pokedex_entries.Pearl: Its appearance changes depending on where it evolved. The materials on hand become a part of its body.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: When evolving, its body takes in surrounding materials. As a result, there are many body variations.
pokedex_entries.HeartGoldSoulSilver: It is said that a WORMADAM that evolves on a cold day will have a thicker cloak.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: When evolving, its body takes in surrounding materials. As a result, there are many body variations.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: Its appearance changes depending on where it evolved. The materials on hand become a part of its body.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant Diamond: When Burmy evolves, its cloak becomes a part of its body. Wormadam’s cloak is never shed.
pokedex_entries.Shining Pearl: Its appearance changes depending on where it evolved. The materials on hand become a part of its body.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: The cloak—fashioned from plant matter—has merged with the Pokémon and is now part of the body, like fur or skin. I suspect this fusion is an effect of the energy involved in evolution.

pokedex_entries.DiamondPearl: By churning its wings, it creates shock waves that inflict critical internal injuries to foes.
pokedex_entries.Platinum: Its jaw power is incredible. It is adept at biting apart foes while flying by at high speed.
pokedex_entries.HeartGold: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.
pokedex_entries.SoulSilver: The beat of its wings is so powerful that it accidentally dislodges full-grown trees when it takes off in flight.
pokedex_entries.BlackWhite: Its jaw power is incredible. It is adept at biting apart foes while flying by at high speed.
pokedex_entries.Black 2White 2: It prefers to battle by biting apart foes’ heads instantly while flying by at high speed.
pokedex_entries.XOmega Ruby: It prefers to battle by biting apart foes’ heads instantly while flying by at high speed.
pokedex_entries.YAlpha Sapphire: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.
pokedex_entries.Brilliant DiamondShining Pearl: By churning its wings, it creates shock waves that inflict critical internal injuries to foes.
pokedex_entries.Legends: Arceus: Extremely violent. When hunting, it wastes none of its energy, aiming only for prey’s most vulnerable spots. Any who manage to tame this Pokémon must be of incredible bravery.
